chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is an 11-year-old female with sickle cell disease presenting with jaundice and abdominal pain. Lab results from Table 1 show peak values: AST 631 U/L at admission, ALT 239 U/L at admission, GGT 51 U/L at 50 days after discharge, total bilirubin 16.1 mg/dL at admission, direct bilirubin 10.3 mg/dL at admission, ALP 371 U/L at 50 days after discharge, albumin 2.8 g/dL at admission, and INR 1.4 at admission. The clinical outcome is improved/discharged as the patient was discharged after treatment, with follow-up showing resolution of the pancreatic mass and remission for over 20 months.

lab_results.Bilirubin: Total bilirubin 16.1 mg/dL, Direct bilirubin 10.3 mg/dL
